0: The Ritz is gently sloped down to a gorgeous beach on a bay
We really enjoyed relaxing on our ocean view balcony after spending the day at the beach before we went to dinner
The view from the beach was absolutely incredible
Water toys like snorkel gear sea kayaks etc
The pool and beach are excellent as are the restaurants
The hotel frames the bay beautifully
There was a bowl of fruit waiting along with a lovely gift of a scented candle inside a sea shell
The ocean is right past the pool
Liked the food in beach restaurant beach is quite nice but nothing close to St Johns beaches
1: The beach has seaweed all over it and has to be cleaned daily but certainly not a pristine beach
Although the Ocean View room we had was more of a view of the construction of the pool
There was an issue with the Sails kitchen which prompted a very limited menu for lunch and food being prepared next to the pool beach on grills under a tent
This is definitely not a pure white sand beach Incase that is what you are looking for

I want to say that we enjoyed the week we spent on the beach staring out into the beautiful blue water but instead of relaxing at a luxurious Ritz Carlton resort for a week at 1250 night there were only 2 restaurants open neither of which were worthy of this brand standard we spent money on taxis at night looking for local restaurants
You could likely leave the Ritz and be sitting on the beach at Trunk Bay in St John in under an hour
With one pool closed on the hotel side it felt a little crowded at the other pools and the beaches were still being worked on
The beach is not a good one rock and stiff vegetation make getting in and out of the water very uncomfortable
The downsides are rebuilding of the beach sand has not allowed ecologically for the beach to be what it once was because this will take time
Pretty to look at but ultimately more of a small bay inlet
